Function Documentation

void* EagleMemory_Allocate ( char *  id,
size_t  size 
)

Allocate a single block of memory.

Memory that is allocated will be zeroed out.

Parameters:
[in] id This is a unique string used for mocking memory allocations. See EagleMemory_Mock()
[in] size The amount of memory to allocate.
Returns:
The pointer to the new memory or NULL upon failure. Failures must be handled in your code and may need to cascade up to recover from the failure.

00022 {
00023     void *m;
00024     
00025 #ifdef CUNIT
00026     /* if we are unit testing, check for mocking */
00027     int i;
00028     for(i = 0; i < EagleMemory_MocksInUse; ++i) {
00029         if(0 == strcmp(EagleMemory_Mocks[i], id)) {
00030             ++EagleMemory_MockInvocations;
00031             return NULL;
00032         }
00033     }
00034 #endif
00035     
00036     /* try the real allocation */
00037     m = malloc(size);
00038     if(NULL == m) {
00039         return NULL;
00040     }
00041     
00042     /* zero out memory */
00043     memset(m, 0, (unsigned long) size);
00044     return m;
00045 }

void EagleMemory_Free ( void *  ptr  ) 

Free a pointer.

The pointer will be set to NULL. It is safe to call this function with NULL and hence to call it multiple times on the same pointer.

Parameters:
[in] ptr Pointer to free.

void EagleMemory_Mock ( char *  id  ) 

Mocking memory allocations.

This is used by the MemorySuite to mock malloc() returning NULL. Every EagleMemory_Allocate() and EagleMemory_MultiAllocate() requires a unique ID. This ID can be sent to EagleMemory_Mock() to make sure that allocation returns NULL and the program handles the failure correctly.

You may have upto 32 mocks for a single test case.

Parameters:
[in] id The ID of the allocation handle to mock.

Definition at line 80 of file EagleMemory.c.

00081 {
00082     if(NULL == EagleMemory_Mocks) {
00083         EagleMemory_Mocks = (char**) calloc((size_t) 32, sizeof(char*));
00084         EagleMemory_MocksInUse = 0;
00085     }
00086     EagleMemory_Mocks[EagleMemory_MocksInUse++] = id;
00087 }

void EagleMemory_MockFinish ( void   ) 

Finish the mocking session.

Run this method at the end of each test case, after invoking EagleMemory_Mock()

Run this method at the top of each test case, before invoking EagleMemory_Mock()

void** EagleMemory_MultiAllocate ( char *  id,
size_t  size,
int  quantity 
)

Allocate a single block to support an array.

There is still only a single allocation, this is eqivilent to calloc().

Parameters:
[in] id This is a unique string used for mocking memory allocations. See EagleMemory_Mock()
[in] size The size of a single array element.
[in] quantity The amount of array items.
Returns:
A new single malloc block.

Definition at line 53 of file EagleMemory.c.

00054 {
00055     return (void**) EagleMemory_Allocate(id, (size_t) quantity * size);
00056 }

void EagleMemory_MultiFree ( void **  ptr,
int  quantity 
)

Free an array of elements.

Note:
This is not the eqivilent opposite of EagleMemory_MultiAllocate(). This function will free each array element, then the whole array itself.
Parameters:
[in] ptr Pointer to array.
[in] quantity The amount of items in the array.

00064     }
